intro: Crateva macrocarpa, commonly known as the Java bean or horse radish tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and distinctive red, fleshy fruits that resemble beans. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its showy flowers. Its fruits are edible when young but become bitter and inedible as they mature.
